Author: imsteve
Content: Why would you ever get a laptop instead of getting a much better bang for the buck desktop if you're never going to move it?

Author: queensnake
Content: There are 'expensive chair' places in / around Boston + suburbs. I don't remember any of the store names but, a search should reward you.

Author: imsteve
Content: Performance isn't the problem. If any of your drives ever corrupt a single bit then all of your data is trashed (with most setups) and that's a big problem.

Author: imsteve
Content:
The cron daemon should be launched at a runlevel preceding anything windowing related, this is the default in all linux distros. So you shouldn't have to log to anything for it to be running.

Also, if you have sshd running, which decent OS will have, then you can automatically take over the computer remotely.

I'm sure this is easily applicable to OSX.

Author: dbrush
Title: Faux Labs, maker of Splashup, looking for .NET developers.
Content:
Funded summer '07 by Y Combinator.

Looking to grow our current one-person development workforce by ++ing once or twice.

Ideally you'll have deep knowledge of C# and .NET development, hopefully with heavy interest in Flex 2/3 and Actionscript 3, with the goal of applying it with zeal in a loosely-structured company that will like people like you.

In return we want to give you stock, money, and an opportunity to wield your seniority when other developers join the company.

Current product is here: http://www.splashup.com

Current email is here: recruiting@fauxlabs.com

Thanks

Author: zach
Content:

Author: skmurphy
Content:
This should really link here: http://www.informationweek.com/shared/printableArticle.jhtml...

It has a more complete version of the table and the blog appears to be just a verbatim copy of the article. That being said it's a good article. I blogged about this same issue in March http://www.skmurphy.com/blog/2007/03/08/selling-around-it-in...

two related blog articles

Ori Weinroth: Is IT the enemy of Office 2.0? http://microsoftstartups.com/blogs/ori/archive/2006/10/12/90...

InformationWeek: Selling Around the CIO http://www.informationweek.com/797/97uwhl.htm

Author: mattmaroon
Content: You are exactly correct. Minus the iPod, their stores probably would have ended a miserable failure. With the iPod, and the resulting Apple hype, they've become one of the highest profit per sq ft stores ever invented.

Author: mattmaroon
Content: I def recommend using PGP full disk encryption for Windows if you have sensitive data on the laptop.

Author: mattmaroon
Content: Actually, I'm almost 100% sure you can after filing the report. I'm not sure you want to though.
